description: Describes the properties of specific versions of DB engines.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The database engine to return version details for. Valid Values: aurora-mysql aurora-postgresql custom-oracle-ee custom-oracle-ee-cdb custom-oracle-se2 custom-oracle-se2-cdb db2-ae db2-se mariadb mysql oracle-ee oracle-ee-cdb oracle-se2 oracle-se2-cdb postgres sqlserver-ee sqlserver-se sqlserver-ex sqlserver-web.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: A specific database engine version to return details for. Example: 5.1.49

parameters.name: DBParameterGroupFamily
parameters.description: The name of a specific DB parameter group family to return details for. Constraints: If supplied, must match an existing DB parameter group family.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: A filter that specifies one or more DB engine versions to describe. Supported filters: db-parameter-group-family - Accepts parameter groups family names. The results list only includes information about the DB engine versions for these parameter group families. engine - Accepts engine names. The results list only includes information about the DB engine versions for these engines. engine-mode - Accepts DB engine modes. The results list only includes information about the DB engine versions for these engine modes. Valid DB engine modes are the following: global multimaster parallelquery provisioned serverless engine-version - Accepts engine versions. The results list only includes information about the DB engine versions for these engine versions. status - Accepts engine version statuses. The results list only includes information about the DB engine versions for these statuses. Valid statuses are the following: available deprecated (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as IDs. The filters supported by a describe operation are documented with the describe operation. The following actions can be filtered: DescribeDBClusterBacktracks DescribeDBClusterEndpoints DescribeDBClusters DescribeDBInstances DescribeDBRecommendations DescribeDBShardGroups DescribePendingMaintenanceActions The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. One or more filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. (string) ---

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more than the MaxRecords value is available, a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so you can retrieve the remaining results. Default: 100 Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

parameters.name: ListSupportedCharacterSets
parameters.description: Specifies whether to list the supported character sets for each engine version. If this parameter is enabled and the requested engine supports the CharacterSetName parameter for CreateDBInstance, the response includes a list of supported character sets for each engine version. For RDS Custom, the default is not to list supported character sets. If you enable this parameter, RDS Custom returns no results.

parameters.name: ListSupportedTimezones
parameters.description: Specifies whether to list the supported time zones for each engine version. If this parameter is enabled and the requested engine supports the TimeZone parameter for CreateDBInstance, the response includes a list of supported time zones for each engine version. For RDS Custom, the default is not to list supported time zones. If you enable this parameter, RDS Custom returns no results.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

nested_items.name: DBEngineVersions
nested_items.description: A list of DBEngineVersion elements.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The name of the database engine.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of the database engine.

nested_items.name: DBParameterGroupFamily
nested_items.description: The name of the DB parameter group family for the database engine.

nested_items.name: DBEngineDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the database engine.

nested_items.name: DBEngineVersionDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the database engine version.

nested_items.name: DefaultCharacterSet
nested_items.description: The default character set for new instances of this engine version, if the CharacterSetName parameter of the CreateDBInstance API isn't specified.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the character set.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the character set.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: A value that indicates the ID of the AMI.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: A value that indicates the status of a custom engine version (CEV).

nested_items.name: DBEngineMediaType
nested_items.description: A value that indicates the source media provider of the AMI based on the usage operation. Applicable for RDS Custom for SQL Server.

nested_items.name: SupportedCharacterSets
nested_items.description: A list of the character sets supported by this engine for the CharacterSetName parameter of the CreateDBInstance operation.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the character set.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the character set.

nested_items.name: SupportedNcharCharacterSets
nested_items.description: A list of the character sets supported by the Oracle DB engine for the NcharCharacterSetName parameter of the CreateDBInstance operation.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the character set.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the character set.

nested_items.name: ValidUpgradeTarget
nested_items.description: A list of engine versions that this database engine version can be upgraded to.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The name of the upgrade target database engine.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of the upgrade target database engine.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The version of the database engine that a DB instance can be upgraded to.

nested_items.name: AutoUpgrade
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the target version is applied to any source DB instances that have AutoMinorVersionUpgrade set to true.

nested_items.name: IsMajorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: Indicates whether upgrading to the target version requires upgrading the major version of the database engine.

nested_items.name: SupportedEngineModes
nested_items.description: A list of the supported DB engine modes for the target engine version.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsParallelQuery
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you can use Aurora parallel query with the target engine version.

nested_items.name: SupportsGlobalDatabases
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you can use Aurora global databases with the target engine version.

nested_items.name: SupportsBabelfish
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you can use Babelfish for Aurora PostgreSQL with the target engine version.

nested_items.name: SupportsLimitlessDatabase
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB engine version supports Aurora Limitless Database.

nested_items.name: SupportsLocalWriteForwarding
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the target engine version supports forwarding write operations from reader DB instances to the writer DB instance in the DB cluster. By default, write operations aren't allowed on reader DB instances.

nested_items.name: SupportsIntegrations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB engine version supports zero-ETL integrations with Amazon Redshift.

nested_items.name: SupportedTimezones
nested_items.description: A list of the time zones supported by this engine for the Timezone parameter of the CreateDBInstance action.

nested_items.name: TimezoneName
nested_items.description: The name of the time zone.

nested_items.name: ExportableLogTypes
nested_items.description: The types of logs that the database engine has available for export to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsLogExportsToCloudwatchLogs
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the engine version supports exporting the log types specified by ExportableLogTypes to CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: SupportsReadReplica
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the database engine version supports read replicas.

nested_items.name: SupportedEngineModes
nested_items.description: A list of the supported DB engine modes.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedFeatureNames
nested_items.description: A list of features supported by the DB engine.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the DB engine version, either available or deprecated.

nested_items.name: SupportsParallelQuery
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you can use Aurora parallel query with a specific DB engine version.

nested_items.name: SupportsGlobalDatabases
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you can use Aurora global databases with a specific DB engine version.

nested_items.name: MajorEngineVersion
nested_items.description: The major engine version of the CEV.

nested_items.name: DatabaseInstallationFilesS3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains your database installation files.

nested_items.name: DatabaseInstallationFilesS3Prefix
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 directory that contains the database installation files. If not specified, then no prefix is assumed.

nested_items.name: DBEngineVersionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the custom engine version.

nested_items.name: KMSKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for an encrypted CEV. This parameter is required for RDS Custom, but optional for Amazon RDS.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The creation time of the DB engine version.

nested_items.name: TagList
nested_items.description: A list of tags.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: SupportsBabelfish
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the engine version supports Babelfish for Aurora PostgreSQL.

nested_items.name: CustomDBEngineVersionManifest
nested_items.description: JSON string that lists the installation files and parameters that RDS Custom uses to create a custom engine version (CEV). RDS Custom applies the patches in the order in which they're listed in the manifest. You can set the Oracle home, Oracle base, and UNIX/Linux user and group using the installation parameters. For more information, see JSON fields in the CEV manifest in the Amazon RDS User Guide.

nested_items.name: SupportsLimitlessDatabase
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB engine version supports Aurora Limitless Database.

nested_items.name: SupportsCertificateRotationWithoutRestart
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the engine version supports rotating the server certificate without rebooting the DB instance.

nested_items.name: SupportedCACertificateIdentifiers
nested_items.description: A list of the supported CA certificate identifiers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsLocalWriteForwarding
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB engine version supports forwarding write operations from reader DB instances to the writer DB instance in the DB cluster. By default, write operations aren't allowed on reader DB instances.

nested_items.name: SupportsIntegrations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB engine version supports zero-ETL integrations with Amazon Redshift.

nested_items.name: ServerlessV2FeaturesSupport
nested_items.description: Specifies any Aurora Serverless v2 properties or limits that differ between Aurora engine versions. You can test the values of this attribute when deciding which Aurora version to use in a new or upgraded DB cluster. You can also retrieve the version of an existing DB cluster and check whether that version supports certain Aurora Serverless v2 features before you attempt to use those features.

nested_items.name: MinCapacity
nested_items.description: If the minimum capacity is 0 ACUs, the engine version supports the automatic pause/resume feature of Aurora Serverless v2.

nested_items.name: MaxCapacity
nested_items.description: Specifies the upper Aurora Serverless v2 capacity limit for a particular engine version. Depending on the engine version, the maximum capacity for an Aurora Serverless v2 cluster might be 256 or 128.
